differential_diagnosis: Polymyositis–systemic sclerosis overlap progressing to renal crisis
Accelerated-phase hypertension unrelated to systemic sclerosis
Nephrotoxic effects of the nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug
Cast nephropathy due to monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance
Hemolytic–uremic syndrome or thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura
Sepsis with or without endocarditis, legionella, or leptospirosis
Acute renal failure due to obstruction of the urinary tract
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with worsening symptoms of scleroderma, acute renal failure, hypertension, and clinical features consistent with scleroderma renal crisis. Laboratory findings and imaging studies supported this diagnosis, alongside the identification of specific histological changes indicative of severe acute vascular injury in the renal biopsy.
